paper_metadata.title: Soil Potassium Balance in the Hilly Region of Central Sichuan, China, Based on Crop Distribution
paper_metadata.primary_focus: Analysis of soil potassium balance characteristics and influencing factors under different cropping conditions in a hilly region.

research_methodology.experimental_design: The study analyzed soil potassium balance under different cropping conditions. It involved soil sampling, crop pattern extraction using remote sensing, and calculation of potassium balance components. Influencing factors were analyzed using correlation and structural equation modeling.

temporal_scope.data_collection_frequency: Multi-temporal (May 2018 to April 2019) for satellite imagery; single collection for soil samples.
temporal_scope.seasonal_coverage: Full annual cycle (May 2018 to April 2019) for crop pattern extraction.

spatial_scope.geographic_coverage: Shehong County, Suining City, Sichuan Province, China
site_characteristics: High in northwest, low in southeast
spatial_scope.regional_representativeness: Core hilly area of Sichuan Province, possessing typical hilly agriculture.

sample_design.replication_levels: Three soil cores randomly collected from each of 56 sites.
sample_design.randomization_approach: Potential sampling points identified based on soil type, parent material, and topography, then adjusted for reachability and actual state.
sample_design.statistical_power: Not explicitly stated, but SEM model fit indices are provided.

measurement_protocols: Soil Rapidly Available Potassium (RAK): Leached with 1.0 mol L⁻¹ neutral NH₄OAC at a 10:1 water–soil ratio.
Soil Slowly Available Potassium (SAK): Leached with 1 mol L⁻¹ boiling HNO₃ at a 10:1 water–soil ratio.
Potassium measurement: Flame photometric method for filtrate.
Crop pattern extraction: Decision tree classification using Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) and Modified Chlorophyll Absorption Ratio Index (MCARI) from Sentinel-2 L1C images.
quality_control: Soil samples air-dried, homogenized, roots/stones removed, finely ground to pass 2 mm sieve.
Sentinel-2 images reprocessed with radiometric calibration, atmospheric correction, and resampling.
Kriging interpolation performance evaluated using cross-validation method with Normalized Root Mean Square Error (NRMSE).
Structural Equation Model (SEM) fit evaluated using chi-square (χ²), degrees of freedom (df), Root Mean Square Error of Approximation (RMSEA), and Goodness-of-Fit Index (GFI).

analysis_methods: Ordinary Kriging interpolation (for RAK and SAK spatial distribution)
Pearson’s correlation analysis (between K balance and environmental factors)
Structural Equation Model (SEM) using AMOS software (for interactions between K balance and environmental factors)
statistical_approach.significance_testing: t-test for Pearson's correlation (0.05 and 0.01 levels); p-values for SEM (e.g., p < 0.001).
statistical_approach.uncertainty_quantification: Standard deviation for RAK and SAK content; Nugget Effect (%) for spatial variability; MSE and RMSSE for kriging interpolation.
statistical_approach.model_validation: Cross-validation for kriging; SEM model fitness parameters (χ²/df < 3, RMSEA < 0.08, GFI > 0.9).

primary_measurements.parameter: Soil Rapidly Available Potassium (RAK) content (0–20 cm)
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Range and average value in the study area.

primary_measurements.parameter: Soil Slowly Available Potassium (SAK) content (0–20 cm)
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Range and average value in the study area.
Range across farmland in the study area.
Mostly ranged, some areas > 220 kg K ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹.
Mostly ranged, township range 129.27–144.33 kg K ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹.

statistical_relationships.effect_size: 20.8% of variance in soil potassium balance explained by climate, topography, anthropogenic activity, and soil available potassium.

comparative_results.comparison_type: Soil Potassium Deficit by Cropping Pattern
comparative_results.practical_significance: Rapeseed–maize rotation had the greatest deficit (-129.50 kg K ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹). Differences between rice–rapeseed (-46.79 kg K ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹) and wheat–maize (-44.07 kg K ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹) were not significant.

comparative_results.comparison_type: Soil Potassium Balance by Cropping Pattern
comparative_results.practical_significance: Only the rice–wheat rotation showed a potassium surplus (31.58 kg K ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹).

comparative_results.comparison_type: Soil Potassium Balance by Cropping System
comparative_results.practical_significance: Soil potassium balance was higher for monoculture systems than for rotation systems due to lower potassium absorption by crops in monocultures.
Rapeseed planting was generally under-applied with potassium, with a deficit of ~-70.12 kg K ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹, which was higher than rice–rapeseed and wheat–maize rotations.

comparative_results.comparison_type: Spatial Distribution of Soil Available Potassium
comparative_results.practical_significance: Soil RAK and SAK content were generally high in the central townships and low in the northern and southern townships.
Under the same cropping pattern, the overall order for potassium input was straw return > irrigation water > rainfall input.

geographic_details.landscape_position: Hilly terrain, high in the northwest and low in the southeast.

temperature_patterns.mean_annual_temperature: Data obtained from National Meteorological Information Center

precipitation_patterns.mean_annual_precipitation: Data obtained from National Meteorological Information Center

climate_characteristics.growing_season: Implied by crop types (rice, maize, wheat, rape), but not explicitly defined.

soil_properties.soil_classification: China Soil System Classification (1995): Penglai Group soils, three gray-brown alluvium-covered soil types (purplish soils, paddy soils, and alluvial soils).
soil_properties.texture: Fine particles (clay and powder) mentioned as physical conservators of soil potassium.
soil_properties.organic_matter: Adequate soil organic matter levels mentioned as influencing soil potassium fixation and uptake capacity.

chemical_properties.pH: Appropriate pH mentioned as influencing soil potassium fixation and uptake capacity.
chemical_properties.cation_exchange: Adequate soil cation exchange mentioned as influencing soil potassium fixation and uptake capacity.
chemical_properties.RAK_level: Low level (average 63.63 mg kg⁻¹ vs. 80 mg kg⁻¹ deprivation threshold).
chemical_properties.SAK_level: Low or moderate level (average 649.77 mg kg⁻¹).

physical_properties.soil_particle_composition: Mentioned as a potential unexplained factor for K balance variation.

soil_properties.mineralogy: Clay minerals (2:1 clay minerals, vermiculite, chlorite) involved in potassium balance processes.

land_use_context.historical_context: Long history of intensive cropping activity in hilly areas of China.

yield_levels.economic_yield_used_in_calculation: Y (economic yield for a crop, kg hm⁻²)

types: Chemical fertilizer (compound fertilizer, converted to K₂O)

rates.annual_potassium_input_range: 63.83 to 100 kg K ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹ (mostly), some areas > 220 kg K ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹

organic_amendments: Livestock and poultry manure (input measured as 0 for main grain crops)

data_collection_schedule: Multi-temporal Sentinel-2 satellite images (May 2018 to April 2019)
study_timeline.monitoring_frequency: Not specified for soil, multi-temporal for satellite images.

long_term_trends.sustainability_implications: Long history of intensive cropping activity and neglected potassium fertilizer inputs have led to depletion of potassium reserves in the soil.

spatial_variability.soil_available_potassium: Strong spatial heterogeneity (nugget effects > 50% for RAK and SAK).

drivers_of_variability: Soil properties (particle composition, basic chemical properties, mineralogical characteristics)

methodological_strengths: High accuracy (84.65% to 89.36%) in crop extraction using decision tree algorithm and multi-temporal Sentinel-2 imagery.
Effective use of Ordinary Kriging for reliable spatial distribution estimates of RAK and SAK.
Application of Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) to quantify complex relationships between potassium balance and environmental factors.
Addresses a research gap by focusing on the impact of crop cultivation types on potassium balance in hilly areas.
methodological_limitations: Potassium uptake data for crops were obtained from literature rather than direct field measurements.
Differences between crop varieties were not considered in potassium uptake calculations.
Organic fertilizer input from livestock and poultry manure was assumed to be zero for main grain crops.
Omission of additional crops (e.g., vegetables, sweet potatoes) in the study area, potentially impacting results.

A significant portion (79.2%) of the variation in soil potassium balance remained unexplained by the SEM model, possibly due to unincluded factors like soil particle composition, basic chemical properties, and mineralogical characteristics.
Calculated potassium inputs and outputs were primarily derived from pertinent literature and field surveys, not always direct measurements.
data_quality_assessment.data_completeness: Some specific yield levels and detailed fertilizer application rates (beyond total K₂O) were not provided. Organic manure input was assumed to be zero.

representativeness.spatial_representativeness: Shehong County is considered a typical hilly agriculture area for central Sichuan Province.
representativeness.temporal_representativeness: Crop pattern extraction based on one year of multi-temporal satellite data (May 2018 to April 2019).
representativeness.system_representativeness: Focuses on main grain crops, but acknowledges omission of other crops like vegetables and sweet potatoes.

uncertainty_sources: Reliance on literature values for crop potassium uptake and some input/output parameters.
Assumption of zero organic manure input for main grain crops.
Exclusion of certain crops (vegetables, sweet potatoes) from the analysis.
Unexplained variance in the structural equation model (79.2%).
validation_evidence: Crop extraction accuracy validated against Statistical Yearbook data.
Kriging interpolation performance evaluated using cross-validation.
SEM model fit indices (χ²/df, RMSEA, GFI) met acceptance criteria.

key_methodological_references: Lu, R. (2000) Methods of Soil and Geochemistry Analysis.
West, S.G.; Taylor, A.B.; Wu, W. (2012) Model Fit and Model Selection in Structural Equation Modeling.
comparative_studies: Compared soil RAK content to Yujiang hilly area of Jiangxi (74.00 mg kg⁻¹) and Pearl River Delta hilly area (77.80 mg kg⁻¹).
Discussed two main types of potassium balance research: crop soil fertilization experiments and statistical/survey data estimation.
literature_integration.theoretical_framework: Soil potassium balance is defined as the difference between soil potassium input and soil potassium output.
data_sources: County Agricultural Bureau (survey data for chemical fertilizer application)
Statistics Bureau (survey data for chemical fertilizer application, sown area)
Farmers (survey data for chemical fertilizer application)
National Meteorological Information Center (mean annual temperature, mean annual precipitation)
ASTER GDEM V2 global digital elevation data (DEM data)
National Geographic Information Resources Catalog Service System (county-level administrative divisions, roads, rivers vector data)
National Earth System Science Data Center (population density grid data)
benchmarking_data: Potassium deprivation threshold of 80 mg kg⁻¹ for soil RAK.

extraction_metadata.data_richness_assessment: The paper is rich in methodological details, quantitative results, and discussions on influencing factors and limitations, allowing for comprehensive extraction.
potential_ambiguities: The distinction between Pearson's correlation coefficients and SEM path coefficients for the relationship between soil AK and K balance (Pearson's showed negative, SEM showed positive direct effect). The SEM result is prioritized for causal interpretation.
extraction_limitations: Specific yield levels for each crop type were not provided, only the K uptake per unit yield.
Detailed breakdown of chemical fertilizer application rates by crop or specific K₂O content of compound fertilizers was not available, only total converted K₂O input.
Exact timing of soil sample collection was not specified beyond 'field investigation'.
recommended_validation_checks: Verify all numerical values and units against the source text and tables.
Confirm the interpretation of statistical relationships, especially between correlation and SEM path coefficients.
